intro: Dioscorea gaumeri, commonly known as the Mexican yam, is a climbing vine native to Central America and parts of the southern United States. It belongs to the family Dioscoreaceae and is characterized by its tuberous roots, which are the primary part used for culinary and medicinal purposes. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Its leaves are heart-shaped and often have a rough texture, while its stems are hairy and tend to climb using tendrils. Dioscorea gaumeri is valued for its nutritional content and has been used in traditional medicine for various ailments.
